group_1.textCenter: We've been walking for days after departing@from Tibet…
At last, we've set foot on Mongolian soil.
W-we're in…Mongolia.@The land of those hateful people…
(The scenery is so similar to Tibet that it's hard@to believe that this is my first time here.)
(Maybe our cultures are akin to each other,@just under a different rule…)
(Or maybe this place was once Tibet too...)

group_1.textRight: Hey, I'm the official interpreter.
You can rest assured that I'll be the one@translating during the meeting.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, uh, but…@You know, I think we'll be okay.

group_1.textRight: Don't be so reserved!@I'll translate everything perfectly for you.
I'm taking care of it, so you can rely on me!@Wahaha!

group_1.textLeft: Um… I don't want to burst your bubble,@because you're so into it…
Actually, we all know Mongolian too.

group_1.textRight: Huh?

group_1.textLeft: Interpretation is not required.
Even I can handle a basic conversation…

group_1.textRight: What? Wait… Wait a minute.@Who am I here to interpret for then…?

group_1.textLeft: …One more person is on their way and@you'll need to interpret for them.

group_1.textRight: Another person?

group_1.textCenter: From this point on, only the delegation can@continue. No funny business, you hear?

group_1.textLeft: There's nothing further ahead…@Shouldn't the yurt be up the road?

group_1.textRight: We have a separate location prepared@for the meeting.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:105101:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Huh?!

group_1.textRight: Heruka?

group_1.textLeft: An-anyways…@We decline.

group_1.textRight: Wh-what?

group_1.textLeft: We are one and the same, never apart.
…Now show us all the way.

group_1.textRight: Please keep them in line…@Or else the consequences will fall on me.

group_1.textLeft: Don't worry.@I'm almost certain you won't be held liable.
(With this number of opponents, there's nothing@he could do if they all went on a rampage...)
(He had a hard time accepting it, but even so,@he still gave into my request.)
This place is…

group_1.textRight: …It looks just like a Tibetan monastery.
Your teachings have been spreading around@this area for a long time.
It's to show you where you're headed.@I thought it was a good location to choose.

group_1.textLeft: You're going to do something stupid.

group_1.textRight: Speak for yourself…@You even brought all of them with you.
...Are you here to fight?

group_1.textLeft: I didn't mean it that way.@This is simply a greeting gift.

group_1.textRight: Greeting gift?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, that's right. I haven't introduced myself…@Hello, I'm Heruka of the nunnery.

group_1.textRight: I know… I've seen your face from a distance.

group_1.textLeft: Hm…
(I didn't think they'd change the location…@Yet here we are.)
(We were able to bring in so many people.@…We'll get what we came for.)

group_1.textRight: …I've been wanting to talk to you for a while.

group_1.textLeft: I'm honored.

group_1.textRight: It wasn't a compliment…@You've been causing fractures in our army.
The little rat you are, you offered us a decisive@battle in order to limit damage to the nunnery.
But it our was army that has been hurt the most.@You've kept us subdued.
…We've had many defections and rebellions.@The more we attacked, the worse they became.
General, there's no need to say all that…!

group_1.textLeft: I simply speak the truth.
And it was this lone woman who brought it@upon us!

group_1.narration: They're fighting under pressure.@I was sure their morale wasn't high to begin with,@but I had no idea the Mongols were driven this far.
Should I change the plan and face them head on?@No, even if we win that battle,@there would be too many casualties.@Scores would die and the land would be ravaged.
In such a state, the people would be unable@to be self-sufficient.
Winning the battle is nothing@in the grand scheme of things!@I will not give my life away@for such a trifle.
I want to put an end to the fighting altogether.

group_1.textLeft: You think very highly of me, don't you?

group_1.textRight: You're the only person we've struggled against@so much.
Even without your mysterious powers,@your cunning is worthy of fear.

group_1.textLeft: …I'm uncomfortable receiving such@high praise…
Still, I'm so glad.

group_1.textRight: For the compliment?

group_1.textLeft: No... That everything's going to work out fine.

group_1.narration: I guess it's time to get started.@The fight to end the fighting.

group_1.textLeft: Well then, General... Would you please make me@a Mongolian officer?
